Class NetworkGraph

java.lang.Object
  ch.epfl.lis.gnwgui.NetworkGraph

public class NetworkGraph
extends java.lang.Object

Implements a graph visualization using the JUNG library.

Author:
Thomas Schaffter (firstname.name@gmail.com)

saveStructureLayout

public void saveStructureLayout()
Save the coordinates {x,y} of all nodes from the graph and save the positions in the individual node of the Structure. Don't capture an eventual rotation or distortion of the JUNGÂ layout.

setGraphMouseMode

public void setGraphMouseMode(int mode)
Modify the way in which the user can interact with the graph.

Parameters:
mode - mode=0: transforming, mode=1: picking

highlightVertexesSelection

public void highlightVertexesSelection(int[] selection)
For the search part, this class has 2 group of vertices: the first contains the vertices (their index) that have their label associated to the search key entered by the user. The second one contains the vertices (generally only one) that have their label matching perfectly to the search key. This function classes all the vertices between these 3 groups following the result of the vertices search.

Parameters:
selection - Vector of that contains the result of the search (see this.search())

addPrintAction

Parameters:
jp - JPanel that contains the network graph.
